general_advisory: The weather is expected to be hot and humid with moderate rainfall. Specific measures to control pests and diseases in crops are recommended.

advisory: There are chances of Leaf webber infestation in Arhar crop. To manage leaf webber in Arhar spray Chlorpyriphos 50 % + Cypermethrin 5 % EC @ 400-ml/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400-ml/acre.

To control Leaf hopper- pyrilla and Mealy Bug in sugarcane crop spray Imidacloprid 17.8 % SL @ 60- ml/acre or Thiamethoxam 25 % WG @ 40-gram/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400-ml/acre by mixing it in 200 litre of water .

Deficit rainfall may leads to infestation of Epilachna Beetle in cucurbit crops. To manage Epilachna Beetle in cucurbits spray neem-based pesticide (Neem Oil 1500 PPM) @ 3-ml/litre of water at early stage of infestation.To manage Epilachna Beetle chemically spray Chlorpyriphos 20 % EC @ 2-ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 2- ml/litre of water .

Present hot and humid weather conditions are congenial for sucking pests like Aphids, White fly and leaf hopper in Okra. To control this spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 50 ml / acre or Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 40 g/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

For cultivation of an acre of Tomato crop 200-gram of improved variety and 50-gram of hybrid seed is required. Apply 20 kg of completely decomposed FYM to each nursery bed ten days before sowing. Treat 1-kg of seeds with 2-gram Carbendazim 50% WP or Carboxin 37.5%+ Thiram 37.5% D.S before sowing.
To manage gram pad borer in cowpea spraying of Emam actin benzoate @ 80-gram/ acre by mixing it in 200 litre of water.
